import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np
from pandas import DataFrame
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

vie = pd.read_csv('../input/chaydumcon/vietnam (1).csv')
sin = pd.read_csv('../input/chaydumcon/singapore (1).csv')

source.d75a5700:
trace1 = go.Scatter(
                    x = vie.Year,
                    y = vie.GDP_per_capita,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Vietnam",
                    marker = dict(color = 'rgba(56, 200, 2, 0.8)'),
                    text= vie.GDP_per_capita)

trace2 = go.Scatter(
                    x = sin.Year,
                    y = sin.GDP_per_capita,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Singapore",
                    marker = dict(color = 'rgba(67, 26, 80, 0.8)'),
                    text= sin.GDP_per_capita)
data = [trace1, trace2]
layout = dict(title = 'So sánh GDP bình quân đầu người Việt Nam và Singapore',
              xaxis= dict(title= 'Year',ticklen= 5,zeroline= False), 
              yaxis= dict(title= 'Scores')
             )
fig = dict(data = data, layout = layout)
iplot(fig)
source.6df4291e:
vie['Country']='Vietnam'
sin['Country']="Singapore"
country=pd.concat([vie,sin])

p = px.bar(country, x='Country', y='Perceptions_of_corruption', 
           animation_frame="Year", 
           animation_group="Country", 
           range_y=[0,0.5],
           color="Country",
           title='Perceptions_of_corruption	',
           width=500, height=500)
p.show()
